title: Simon Cowell ‘didn’t have a clue’ who X Factor: Celebrity acts were before filming
text:
Simon Cowell didn’t want to know who the celebrity acts on X Factor were (Picture: ITV)

Simon Cowell has stated he didn’t have any idea who the contestants were on X Factor: Celebrity before filming began on the show.

The 60-year-old music mogul will be joined by judges Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger for the new celebrity spin on the show, which sees Love Island supergroups go up against Martin Bashir.

Simon has revealed how he didn’t want to know who any of the acts were before they began filming, in what he believed was an essential ingredient for the show’s success.

‘It just felt so obvious to do a celebrity version,’ Simon said.

Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards are also on X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: ITV)

‘The only condition was I couldn’t know who was going to be in it. I said to the team, “You’ve got to find some acts who you believe can sell records off the back of this, because if you don’t do that it won’t work.”

‘So that was the deal and we stuck to it. I swear to God I didn’t have a clue who any of the acts were. I did walk away thinking, “If we’re smart, we have artists here who could actually sell records off the back of this”. So I thought that was fun and very exciting for the show.’

Instead of the traditional format, The X Factor is returning this year with a celebrity edition and an all stars series comprised of past acts on the show.

The line-up of the celebrity version includes Megan McKenna, Glee’s Kevin McHale, Martin Bashir, talk show host Ricki Lake, and more.
